SEARCH
Package Helpers.CustomerHelpers

Class ServerWriter

java.lang.Object
Helpers.CustomerHelpers.ServerWriter
public class ServerWriter extends Object
Class that handles all messages sent to the server after handshake is completed and connection is valid.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerWriter

      public ServerWriter(ServerInterface serverInterface, PrintWriter writer)
      Creates a server writer.
      Parameters:
      serverInterface - reference to ServerInterface, used for checking the connection and checking that messages are being received
      writer - using the same writer as the writer used by ServerInterface for the handshake

  • Method Details

    • initMessage

      private void initMessage()
      Initialize a new message.

    • parseInputAndSendMessageToServer

      public void parseInputAndSendMessageToServer(String[] input)
      Constructs a message from the user input, checks the connection, sends the message to the server and checks if the message has been received.
      Parameters:
      input - the text input from the customer

    • checkConnection

      private void checkConnection()
      Tests connection by sending a PING request.

    • checkReceived

      private void checkReceived()
      Calls for the ServerInterface to check that a message has been received from the server.

    • parseInputAndSendMessageToServer

      private void parseInputAndSendMessageToServer()
      Calls parseAndSetCommandToMessage() to parse and set the command. If the input is an order, call setMessageBodyForOrderCommand() to add the number of drinks and drink/s to the message body. If no errors have been detected, send the message to the server.

    • parseAndSetCommandToMessage

      private void parseAndSetCommandToMessage()
      Sets the parsed command to the Message, sets the error message if the command is unknown.

    • parseAndSetOrderCommand

      private void parseAndSetOrderCommand()
      Checks if the command is 'order n DRINK/s' or 'order status'.

    • setMessageBodyForOrderCommand

      private void setMessageBodyForOrderCommand()
      Remove 'order' from input, join the rest and set the message body.

    • sendMessageToServer

      private void sendMessageToServer()
      Sends the Message to the server.
